reviewText: If you enjoy scaring little kids & adults to death. then this is the game for you. The best thing about the game is seeing fat adults making the *I just ♥♥♥♥ my pants* motion XD I enjoyed the game for the first 20 mins. After that, it's pretty boring. reviewText: I've only briefly played it, enough to get to round 5 a couple times, and I find this pretty fun.  This is a game you can play when you have a spare 5-10 minutes.  I imagine if you were playing it non-stop, the music might get a little annoying, but other than that, I'd recommend this game, espcecially for free.\n\nThe controls do take some getting use to, but once you got it, it becomes easier to find everybody and scare them.   Give it a try, there's nothing to lose except possibly 10 minutes.

reviewText:
Yay! First review! Just to say how much a waste of time this is! WOO!
The song repeats.
The gameplay repeats.
Everything in this damn game repeats.
Even the sounds.
The animations.
THE PLACES THE VICTIMS COME IN.
All in all, I guess it'd be fair for me to say that this game has potential.
But that's a stretch.
These people had a software where they could be much more capable of a better game.
They might even be able to get some money while they're at it.
But it's a bunch of bull.
It's free to play, so what the hell, give it a try..
Have fun scaring the same people the same way in the same places!!

reviewText:
Product received for free

An interesting game to say the least.  There's very little to this game, but I can't deny that there's just something special about scaring the living daylights ouf of people.  It reminds me a lot of the game Haunting Starring Pouterguy on the Sega Genesis, which I personally found to be a lot of fun.  I do have to add that it is incredibly tough.

This is a decent game that, while you're only going to play it a for little bits at a time, there was just something addictive about it that kept me coming back, other than the achievements.

It's a free-to-play game, and check it out only if you're into that kind of thing.

reviewText:
I love the concept, I think it is really fun and I love the full control of the character and how easy it is to go through everything. Controls I feel are very easy to get used to.

It could see more variety in its soundtrack and more of a hint to the story behind the ghoul kid or the story of the house.

Overall I like it, and I can see so much potential in future updates like different venues, objects, music, etc.

reviewText: Ghoul Kid is a neat concept, but there is not much to do in game yet. You simply hid in household objects and scare the visitors to death, recharging some buffs/ abilities along the way. Without more content added and smoothing out the patchy parts of the game (animations, sound) I can only say that Ghoul Kid is neat and worth looking at. I will have to wait and see where it goes before I recommend it toe everyone.

reviewText: It's quite amusingYou play a ghoul in a house. Various numbers of people enter the house per round, and your job is to possess objects and scare each of them till they reach a certain threshold and drop dead of shock. There is a timer so you have to do it fast, or you end up being the dead one. (That is, if ghouls can even die.)\n\nIt has issues with movementThe game is in 3D - using the keyboard with your left hand, you have to control how near/far your ghoul is, and using the mouse with your right hand, you control how high/low he is. This wouldn't be a problem, except for the sliding" that occurs with each move. That is
date: if you stop pressing the left mouse button or the "left" command on the keyboard for instance
hoursPlayed: but continues to move a bit more before he finally does. This lack of precision with the controls makes it hard to accurately control your ghoul
voteText: and becomes especially frustrating because there is a timer every round
helpfulPercent: so not having precise movement wastes the amount of time you have left.\n\nWould've been better with some semblance of a storyOr at least
votesHelpful: a point to all of this. Of course

and trophy bear among many others.)

reviewText: I really, really can't recommend this.  If you want to scare the mortal fools, go look up Haunt the House-it's a 2D version that this was obviously inspired by, it doesn't have the relentless timer or the serious control issues with changing rooms/floors, and it's free.\n\nIf you'd rather play on Steam, you can pay for a different version of Haunt the House right here... though if you're determined to pay, I'd highly recommend the old-but-good Ghost Master instead.  Why control a single, simpleminded poltergeist when you can have an entire cadre of spirits and haunts set up so they're ready to hammer a panicked lout who's fleeing from the last scary encounter?

reviewText:
Product received for free

It's a free game. You're a Ghost haunting a mansion and you're trying to scare potential buyers to your mansion. The concept is like Casper, the friendly ghost. I would probably recommend this to people to try once since it's free, but that's the end of it. Nothing really interesting beyond triggering traps.

PROS
1. It's free
Free stuff. You even have to check a box that says Check this box if you received this product for free."

2. The Different Scares
I kind of liked how the different objects did different things when they scared people.

CONS
1. Repetitive
You do nothing except inhabiting items by pressing E and triggering it when the victims get close by. You know your aura radius based on the circle. Very similar to activating traps.

2. Controls.
Left Click to Float Up
date:
Right Click to Float Down. Those aren't intuitive. I would have preferred Spacebar to float up and Left Ctrl to Float Down



"

reviewText:
Product received for free

Ghoul kid seems like an inspiration from the Sega Genesis game Haunting".  You play as ghoul kid (a ghostly apparition) who needs to haunt objects in a home to kill the stranger’s visiting it.

There are three different types of enemies who differ in the amount of items you need to haunt near them to kill and the models.  Killing a certain type of enemy will give you point towards a power up that can be activated to assist you.  All enemies in a wave need to die before 99 seconds expire or you lose.  It appears that the waves are endless
date: but I only made it to wave 6 before getting overwhelmed.  All controls are customizable and there appears to be a fair amount of video settings.  The one setting that this game is missing is audio as the music can be a little annoying after time.\n\nIn my opinion
recommended: this game does not offer much in replay ability in spite of the 3 modes that can be selected.  If this is the developers first attempt at creating a game
hoursPlayed: he did a phenomenal job.  However
voteText:
I don’t recommend this game more than just a 5-10 min time waster.  This game would probably benefit more from being on a mobile device.

If you would like to see more of this game please check out the link below.  I have created other videos for free games on steam if you would like to check them out.  https://youtu.be/Rf6EdO5T8qU
"

reviewText:
Cool idea for a game, I don't feel its a stretch for this games potential.

This review will be mostly critique as I am hoping to see improvements to this game. I really want to be able to recommend Ghoul Kid in the future.


Graphics for the Ghoul Kid feel more polished than the levels and other characters, almost like conflicting/different art styles.   Ghoul kid looks awesome

Was hard to get a good grasp of the game with the slow camera movement.   I didn't like how the character can move out of the screen.   I think a more fluid camera where it feels like your flying with ghoul kid would be a nice touch.  To be honest the camera made me want to stop playing.

I think ghoul kids animation needs to be faster or he needs to move slower.   The animation doesn't match the movement speed.

I found it hard to use the mouse and the keyboard for movement.   I feel the game would function better as a 3D platformer like super smash bros with 2 deminsions of control.

Ideas?   Perhaps not imobilizing ghost kid when haunting. Then you could do combo scares and direct the scares more.  Perhaps different types of traps.  ex. instead of using the phone to scare, the AI could move towards it.  Also activating a trap too early could cause the character to run in the opposite direction.

Its a good start, congrats on finishing your first release.  Catchy name
